definition: to administer a monastery Buddhist or Daoist/abbot/head monk
to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

sentences.english: So Master Sugehara named his temple "The Date Monastery".
sentences.chinese: 长老遂把自己住持的寺院更名为枣寺。

sentences.english: He is now a Vajra Master of Hong Kong Thrangu Centre.
sentences.chinese: 他现担任香港创古中心的住持法师。

sentences.english: My master was Abbot Xingzheng. I was born to a devout Buddhist family of several generations of believers.
sentences.chinese: 我师父是当时少林寺的住持，方丈行正老和尚。

sentences.english: The head monk gave Hu a tiny, brown robe to wear.
sentences.chinese: 住持给胡穿上一件小小的棕色僧袍。

sentences.english: Therefore, he not only failed to enlighten the abbot, he irritated him unnecessarily.
sentences.chinese: 因此，他不仅没有启发住持，他恼怒他不必要的。

sentences.english: Obviously, Er Ji is honest and should be the abbot.
sentences.chinese: 显然，二寂是诚实的，理应由他来当住持。

sentences.english: In ancient China the cook was revered second only to the abbot.
sentences.chinese: 中国古代，厨师的地位仅次于寺庙的住持。

sentences.english: The abbot decided to hold the initiation ceremony tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 住持决定明天举行传戒仪式。

sentences.english: The priest is trying to teach him how to meditate .
sentences.chinese: 这位住持现在正试著教牠打坐。

sentences.english: Added dialogue when returning the book to the Abbot, having not been given the quest yet.
sentences.chinese: 增加了对话的书时，返回的住持，在未得到的追求呢。

sentences.english: Hu did not dare ask the head monk, because he was afraid that the monk would think he was silly.
sentences.chinese: 胡不敢去问住持，因为他害怕住持觉得他很傻气。

sentences.english: Hu did not dare ask the head monk, because he was afraid that the monk would think he was silly.
sentences.chinese: 胡不敢去问住持，因为他害怕住持觉得他很傻气。

sentences.english: Finally, one day, the master allows her to go out.
sentences.chinese: 终于有一天，住持允许她去闯闯世界了。
